summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message about relationships from Pastor Travis Hearn! In this sermon about 'A Match Made in Heaven', PT dives deep into God's blueprint for marriages and relationships. Can you imagine a love that's not just about feelings, but about commitment, compromise, and Christ-centeredness? Pastor Travis breaks down what it truly means to have a biblical relationship that goes beyond the world's shallow definition of love. He challenges us to view marriage not as a 50/50 arrangement, but a 100/100 commitment where we're constantly giving and sacrificing for each other. Using powerful examples from scripture, he reminds us that true love isn't about what you can get, but what you can give. The most profound moment? When he shares that the 'sexiest' thing about his wife was seeing her worshipping God with hands raised and tears streaming down her face. Isn't that a beautiful picture of what real love looks like? Pastor Travis doesn't just preach about love - he provides a roadmap for building relationships that honor God, emphasizing that a match made in heaven starts with Christ as the foundation.

versesMentioned.text: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails.
My dear brothers and sisters, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry.
Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.

Submit to one another out of reverence for Christ. Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands as you do to the Lord. For the husband is the head of the wife as Christ is the head of the church, his body, of which he is the Savior. Now as the church submits to Christ, so also wives should submit to their husbands in everything. Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her.

Some Pharisees came to him to test him. They asked, 'Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any and every reason?' 'Haven't you read,' he replied, 'that at the beginning the Creator made them male and female,' and said, 'For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife, and the two will become one flesh'? So they are no longer two, but one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.
Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness?

Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock. The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house; yet it did not fall, because it had its foundation on the rock. But everyone who hears these words of mine and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man who built his house on sand. The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell with a great crash.

Monday.scripture: 1 Corinthians 13:4-5: 'Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking.'
Monday.action: Make a list of three ways you can put someone else's needs before your own today. Choose at least one to act on intentionally.
Monday.prayer: Father, teach me to love like You love - selflessly and unconditionally. Help me to choose others over myself today. Guide my heart to serve and love without expecting anything in return. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Ephesians 4:2-3: 'Be completely humble and gentle; be patient, bearing with one another in love. Make every effort to keep the unity of the Spirit through the bond of peace.'
Tuesday.focus: Practicing patience and humility in relationships
Tuesday.action: Identify one relationship where you struggle with patience. Write a letter (not to be sent) expressing understanding and empathy from the other person's perspective.
Tuesday.prayer: Lord, soften my heart. Help me to see others through Your eyes of compassion. Give me patience where I am quick to judge and humility where I am prone to pride. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 31:10-11: 'A wife of noble character who can find? She is worth far more than rubies. Her husband has full confidence in her and lacks nothing of value.'
Wednesday.action: Reflect on your current relationships. Identify one area where you can build more trust through transparency, communication, or consistent follow-through.
Wednesday.prayer: God, help me to be a person of integrity. Show me where I can build deeper trust in my relationships. Give me wisdom to communicate openly and honestly. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Colossians 3:13: 'Bear with each other and forgive one another if any of you has a grievance against someone. Forgive as the Lord forgave you.'
Thursday.action: Reach out to someone you've had a misunderstanding with. Offer genuine forgiveness, even if they haven't apologized.
Thursday.prayer: Father, give me a heart of forgiveness. Help me to release any bitterness or resentment. Teach me to love like You love, extending grace even when it's difficult. Amen.

Friday.scripture: 1 Peter 4:8: 'Above all, love each other deeply, because love covers over a multitude of sins.'
Friday.action: Do something unexpected and sacrificial for your spouse, family member, or close friend. Choose an act of service that requires no recognition.
Friday.prayer: Lord, teach me to love deeply and sacrificially. Help me to love others the way You love me - without condition and with complete grace. Reveal opportunities to show Your love today. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Philippians 2:3-4: 'Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in prayer and reflection. Ask God to reveal areas of selfishness in your relationships and heart. Journal your insights.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, expose the areas of my heart where I am self-centered. Help me to truly value others above myself. Transform my heart to reflect Your selfless love. Amen.
